PText: Paul, a servant of God, and an apostle of Jesus Christ, according to the faith of God's elect, and the acknowledging of the truth which is after godliness;
RText: Paul, a servant of God, and an apostle of Jesus Christ, according to the faith of God's elect, and the acknowledging of the truth which is after godliness;

PText: In hope of eternal life, which God, that cannot lie, promised before the world began;
RText: In hope of eternal life, which God, that cannot lie, promised before the world began;

PText: But hath in due times manifested his word through preaching, which is committed unto me according to the commandment of God our Saviour;
RText: But hath in due times manifested his word through preaching, which is committed unto me according to the commandment of God our Saviour;

PText: To Titus, mine own son after the common faith: Grace, mercy, and peace, from God the Father and the Lord Jesus Christ our Saviour.
RText: To Titus, mine own son after the common faith: Grace, mercy, and peace, from God the Father and the Lord Jesus Christ our Saviour.

PText: For this cause left I thee in Crete, that thou shouldest set in order the things that are wanting, and ordain elders in every city, as I had appointed thee:
RText: ¶For this cause left I thee in Crete, that thou shouldest set in order the things that are wanting, and ordain elders in every city, as I had appointed thee:

PText: If any be blameless, the husband of one wife, having faithful children not accused of riot or unruly.
RText: If any be blameless, the husband of one wife, having faithful children not accused of riot or unruly.

PText: For a bishop must be blameless, as the steward of God; not selfwilled, not soon angry, not given to wine, no striker, not given to filthy lucre;
RText: For a bishop must be blameless, as the steward of God; not selfwilled, not soon angry, not given to wine, no striker, not given to filthy lucre;

PText: But a lover of hospitality, a lover of good men, sober, just, holy, temperate;
RText: But a lover of hospitality, a lover of good men, sober, just, holy, temperate;

PText: Holding fast the faithful word as he hath been taught, that he may be able by sound doctrine both to exhort and to convince the gainsayers.
RText: Holding fast the faithful word as he hath been taught, that he may be able by sound doctrine both to exhort and to convince the gainsayers.

PText: For there are many unruly and vain talkers and deceivers, specially they of the circumcision:
RText: For there are many unruly and vain talkers and deceivers, specially they of the circumcision:

PText: Whose mouths must be stopped, who subvert whole houses, teaching things which they ought not, for filthy lucre's sake.
RText: Whose mouths must be stopped, who subvert whole houses, teaching things which they ought not, for filthy lucre's sake.

PText: One of themselves, even a prophet of their own, said, The Cretians are alway liars, evil beasts, slow bellies.
RText: One of themselves, even a prophet of their own, said, The Cretians are alway liars, evil beasts, slow bellies.

PText: This witness is true. Wherefore rebuke them sharply, that they may be sound in the faith;
RText: This witness is true. Wherefore rebuke them sharply, that they may be sound in the faith;

PText: Not giving heed to Jewish fables, and commandments of men, that turn from the truth.
RText: Not giving heed to Jewish fables, and commandments of men, that turn from the truth.

PText: Unto the pure all things are pure: but unto them that are defiled and unbelieving is nothing pure; but even their mind and conscience is defiled.
RText: Unto the pure all things are pure: but unto them that are defiled and unbelieving is nothing pure; but even their mind and conscience is defiled.

PText: They profess that they know God; but in works they deny him, being abominable, and disobedient, and unto every good work reprobate.
RText: They profess that they know God; but in works they deny him, being abominable, and disobedient, and unto every good work reprobate.

PText: But speak thou the things which become sound doctrine:
RText: But speak thou the things which become sound doctrine:

PText: That the aged men be sober, grave, temperate, sound in faith, in charity, in patience.
RText: That the aged men be sober, grave, temperate, sound in faith, in charity, in patience.

PText: The aged women likewise, that they be in behaviour as becometh holiness, not false accusers, not given to much wine, teachers of good things;
RText: The aged women likewise, that they be in behaviour as becometh holiness, not false accusers, not given to much wine, teachers of good things;

PText: That they may teach the young women to be sober, to love their husbands, to love their children,
RText: That they may teach the young women to be sober, to love their husbands, to love their children,

PText: To be discreet, chaste, keepers at home, good, obedient to their own husbands, that the word of God be not blasphemed.
RText: To be discreet, chaste, keepers at home, good, obedient to their own husbands, that the word of God be not blasphemed.

PText: Young men likewise exhort to be sober minded.
RText: Young men likewise exhort to be sober minded.

PText: In all things shewing thyself a pattern of good works: in doctrine shewing uncorruptness, gravity, sincerity,
RText: In all things shewing thyself a pattern of good works: in doctrine shewing uncorruptness, gravity, sincerity,

PText: Sound speech, that cannot be condemned; that he that is of the contrary part may be ashamed, having no evil thing to say of you.
RText: Sound speech, that cannot be condemned; that he that is of the contrary part may be ashamed, having no evil thing to say of you.

PText: Exhort servants to be obedient unto their own masters, and to please them well in all things; not answering again;
RText: Exhort servants to be obedient unto their own masters, and to please them well in all things; not answering again;

PText: Not purloining, but shewing all good fidelity; that they may adorn the doctrine of God our Saviour in all things.
RText: Not purloining, but shewing all good fidelity; that they may adorn the doctrine of God our Saviour in all things.

PText: For the grace of God that bringeth salvation hath appeared to all men,
RText: For the grace of God that bringeth salvation hath appeared to all men,

PText: Teaching us that, denying ungodliness and worldly lusts, we should live soberly, righteously, and godly, in this present world;
RText: Teaching us that, denying ungodliness and worldly lusts, we should live soberly, righteously, and godly, in this present world;

PText: Looking for that blessed hope, and the glorious appearing of the great God and our Saviour Jesus Christ;
RText: Looking for that blessed hope, and the glorious appearing of the great God and our Saviour Jesus Christ;

PText: Who gave himself for us, that he might redeem us from all iniquity, and purify unto himself a peculiar people, zealous of good works.
RText: Who gave himself for us, that he might redeem us from all iniquity, and purify unto himself a peculiar people, zealous of good works.

PText: These things speak, and exhort, and rebuke with all authority. Let no man despise thee.
RText: These things speak, and exhort, and rebuke with all authority. Let no man despise thee.

PText: Put them in mind to be subject to principalities and powers, to obey magistrates, to be ready to every good work,
RText: Put them in mind to be subject to principalities and powers, to obey magistrates, to be ready to every good work,

PText: To speak evil of no man, to be no brawlers, but gentle, shewing all meekness unto all men.
RText: To speak evil of no man, to be no brawlers, but gentle, shewing all meekness unto all men.

PText: For we ourselves also were sometimes foolish, disobedient, deceived, serving divers lusts and pleasures, living in malice and envy, hateful, and hating one another.
RText: For we ourselves also were sometimes foolish, disobedient, deceived, serving divers lusts and pleasures, living in malice and envy, hateful, and hating one another.

PText: But after that the kindness and love of God our Saviour toward man appeared,
RText: But after that the kindness and love of God our Saviour toward man appeared,

PText: Not by works of righteousness which we have done, but according to his mercy he saved us, by the washing of regeneration, and renewing of the Holy Ghost;
RText: Not by works of righteousness which we have done, but according to his mercy he saved us, by the washing of regeneration, and renewing of the Holy Ghost;

PText: Which he shed on us abundantly through Jesus Christ our Saviour;
RText: Which he shed on us abundantly through Jesus Christ our Saviour;

PText: That being justified by his grace, we should be made heirs according to the hope of eternal life.
RText: That being justified by his grace, we should be made heirs according to the hope of eternal life.

PText: This is a faithful saying, and these things I will that thou affirm constantly, that they which have believed in God might be careful to maintain good works. These things are good and profitable unto men.
RText: This is a faithful saying, and these things I will that thou affirm constantly, that they which have believed in God might be careful to maintain good works. These things are good and profitable unto men.

PText: But avoid foolish questions, and genealogies, and contentions, and strivings about the law; for they are unprofitable and vain.
RText: But avoid foolish questions, and genealogies, and contentions, and strivings about the law; for they are unprofitable and vain.

PText: A man that is an heretick after the first and second admonition reject;
RText: A man that is an heretick after the first and second admonition reject;

PText: Knowing that he that is such is subverted, and sinneth, being condemned of himself.
RText: Knowing that he that is such is subverted, and sinneth, being condemned of himself.

PText: When I shall send Artemas unto thee, or Tychicus, be diligent to come unto me to Nicopolis: for I have determined there to winter.
RText: ¶When I shall send Artemas unto thee, or Tychicus, be diligent to come unto me to Nicopolis: for I have determined there to winter.

PText: Bring Zenas the lawyer and Apollos on their journey diligently, that nothing be wanting unto them.
RText: Bring Zenas the lawyer and Apollos on their journey diligently, that nothing be wanting unto them.

PText: And let ours also learn to maintain good works for necessary uses, that they be not unfruitful.
RText: And let ours also learn to maintain good works for necessary uses, that they be not unfruitful.

PText: All that are with me salute thee. Greet them that love us in the faith. Grace be with you all. Amen.
RText: All that are with me salute thee. Greet them that love us in the faith. Grace be with you all. Amen.
